etymology.description: 一(一) (yī, "one") + 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") = overseeing one's speech or words -> manage
etymology.interpretation: The character 司(司) (sī, "manage") combines 一(一) (yī, "one") and 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") suggesting the idea of control or direction over speech, symbolizing management or supervision.

examples.chinese: 他司图书馆(他司圖書館)，井井有条(井井有條)。
examples.pinyin: Tā sī lǐ túshūguǎn, jǐng jǐng yǒu tiáo.
examples.english: He manages the library, keeping it in perfect order.

examples.chinese: 他亲自司掌全局(他親自司掌全局)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qīnzì sī zhǎng quán jú.
examples.english: He personally takes charge of the overall situation.
